channel.title: Our Projects on Entwine Centre
channel.description: Recent content in Our Projects on Entwine Centre

item.title: BMRPP: Blockchain-based Multi-Robot Path Planning
item.description: The blockchain is a secure and trustworthy distributed transaction management system that is being extensively researched and developed for various applications and use cases.

item.title: BOAT: Buffer Overflow Attacks on IoT devices
item.description: The vulnerability of electronic systems to attacks from hostile agents over the Internet is a matter of growing concern as the digital world becomes increasingly interconnected.

item.title: DroneDrain: A Comparative Study on Energy Consumption Models for Drones
item.description: Creating an appropriate energy consumption prediction model is becoming an important topic for drone-related research in the literature.

item.title: Econet: Low Energy Consumption Networks
item.description: The project consortium was led by Consorzio Nazionale Interuniversitario Per Le Telecomunicazioni, Italy (CNET) and funded by Framework Programme 7 under Contract no.

item.title: INPUT: In-Network Programmability for next-generation personal cloUd service supporT
item.description: The project consortium was led by Consorzio Nazionale Interuniversitario Per Le Telecomunicazioni, Italy (CNET) and funded by Horizon 2020 under Grant Agreement 644672.

item.title: LowLow: Low power, low latency IoT image processing
item.description: Bringing real-time image analysis to the Internet of Things (IoT) poses many challenges.

item.title: Pathfinder
item.description: Pathfinder I and Pathfinder II PIs: Derek Molloy (Entwine), Conor Brennan (School of Electronic Engineering, DCU) The Pathfinder project was funded under the Enterprise Ireland Commercialisation Fund and commenced in March 2018.

item.title: Six4: 6LoWPAN Forwarding for IoT
item.description: Recently, there has been significant interest in the 6LoWPAN standard and its applicability to IoT.
